Song.title: Leaning On The Everlasting Arms
Song.copyright: Words by Eli­sha Hoff­man Music by An­tho­ny Sho­wal­ter Public domain

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: [G]What a fellowship,{,} [C6]what a [C]joy divine, [G]Leaning on the everlasting [D]arms; [G]What a blessedness,{,} [C6]what a [C]peace is mine, [G/D]Leaning on the everlast[D]ing [G]arms.
Chorus: [G]Leaning, [C]leaning, [G]Safe and secure from all a[D]larms; [G]Leaning, [C]leaning, [G]Leaning on the everlast[D]ing [G]arms.
Verse 2: [G]O how sweet to walk{,} [C6]in this [C]pilgrim way, [G]Leaning on the everlasting [D]arms; [G]O how bright the path{,} [C6]grows from [C]day to day, [G/D]Leaning on the everlast[D]ing [G]arms.
Verse 3: [G]What have I to dread,{,} [C6]what have [C]I to fear, [G]Leaning on the everlasting [D]arms; [G]I have blessed peace{,} [C6]with my [C]Lord so near, [G/D]Leaning on the everlast[D]ing [G]arms.
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 what a fellowship what a joy divine leaning on the everlasting arms what a blessedness what a peace is mine leaning on the everlasting arms chorus leaning leaning safe and secure from all alarms leaning leaning leaning on the everlasting arms verse 2 o how sweet to walk in this pilgrim way leaning on the everlasting arms o how bright the path grows from day to day leaning on the everlasting arms verse 3 what have i to dread what have i to fear leaning on the everlasting arms i have blessed peace with my lord so near leaning on the everlasting arms
